summary:
I have been with EY for 33 years, of which I served the last 25 years as a partner in the International Tax practice of EY, located at the EY office in Amsterdam. I decided to retire on February 1st, 2022, to focus on supporting my dear wife Hanne Jesca with her fast moving career at EY and be there for my children, Bella, Dexter and Bibi, when they need me. Furthermore I want to contribute to society in the best way I can.

The years at EY have been super exiting, at times challenging but very rewarding. My motto has always been to bring the best of EY to our clients, acting as one globally integrated team, no matter which region, country, service line, SSLs or competency the resources are located in – winning in the market and delivering exceptional client services as one EY has always my only sole driver. Over the years I have had the privilege to work together with many wonderful colleagues and clients and EY always gave me the opportunity to initiate, be part of and/or develop new business initiatives, with a few key landmarks:
 
1988: Starting my career in the international tax practice in Amsterdam, followed by a 5-year rotation to the US; part of the Dutch Desk in New York and subsequently setting up the Dutch Desk in Chicago
1996 : Being one of the founders of our Global OME offering - formerly known as Tax Effective Supply Chain Management - and leading this practice as part of the TP – TESCM group in Amsterdam; leading some of the most exiting globally integrated OME transformations 
2009: Establishing OME as one of the first 3 segments in the EMEIA Tax Center when it was established. 
2019: Leading our Agile Tax campaign and the SAP alliance for Tax in EMEIA. Technology in general and SAP in particular has been a totally new “field of play” for me, which has brought me totally outside of my “OME comfort zone”, but at the same time has given me a lot of new energy and compassion to win for EY in the market. 
 
Driving personal ambitions and team goals with passion, dedication and deep personal interaction with colleagues and clients across the globe based on mutual trust, full transparency and unprecedented team spirit has always given me the energy to achieve the best for EY and our clients. What I have specifically enjoyed in my last role as Agile Tax lead has been to coach our next generation - allowing other people to shine and realize their full potential has been extremely rewarding and is all what counts. I will definitely miss being part of the EY family but look back at a great career and forward to the next chapter!

profile_positions.description: Cabanas La Luna is a small boutique hotel directly located at the beautiful beaches of Tulum Mexico. My wife and I acquired the land in March 2007, because we were inspired by its beauty, serenity and spiritual vibe of the place. Since then we have build 10 large suits for families and groups, with a total of 45 beds, plus a beautiful beach restaurant, serving traditional mexican food with an international touch.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description: In my EMEIA Agile Tax & SAP Tax leader role, I was responsible to support EY's SAP practice in EMEIA and its clients to drive tax compliance, efficiency and automation into large S4 Hana transformation programs
profile_positions.title: EMEIA Agile Tax & SAP TAX Alliance leader

profile_positions.description: In my EMEIA Agile Tax & SAP Tax leader role, I was responsible to support EY's SAP practice in EMEIA and its clients to drive tax compliance, efficiency and automation into large S4 Hana transformation programs
profile_positions.title: EMEIA Agile Tax & SAP TAX Alliance leader

profile_positions.description: As an OME partner at the ETC I have led various large operating model transformation engagements for clients across the globe. Largest program I have led for a German DAX 30 consumer products company, setting up a global supply chain company in Amsterdam, the Netherlands
profile_positions.title: Partner Operating Model Effectiveness EMEIA Tax Center

profile_positions.description: As the EMEIA OME segment leader I built a group of 30 professionals, partners, senior managers and managers located across EMEIA in cities like Amsterdam, Dusseldorf, Zurich, Geneva and London, helping clients to transform their operating models from an organizational, process, transactional transfer pricing,  legal entity structure and regulatory perspective.
profile_positions.title: EMEIA OME Segment Leader ETC

profile_positions.description: I supporting the development of a European Tax Effective Supply Chain Management practice, helping clients to centralize their supply chain operating models, setting up head quarters in locations like Brussels, Amsterdam, Zurich and Geneva.
profile_positions.title: European Tax Effective Supply Chain leader

profile_positions.description: Established and led the first Tax desk in the EY Chicago office, supporting multinational clients in the Midwest area with international tax structuring.
profile_positions.title: Lead of Dutch Tax desk in Chicago

profile_positions.description: As a senior manager of the Dutch tax desk, I worked under the leadership of the lead tax partner and the other members of the Dutch and other foreign tax desks in NY on supporting clients with international tax structuring
profile_positions.title: Senior manager Dutch Tax desk in NY

profile_positions.description: Part of the International Tax Services practice of EY in the Netherlands
profile_positions.title: Manager
